This was the worst used 20 mins of my life. I couldn't go on anymore, it was so bad, the acting was terrible, the storyline was terrible, I think you could watch TikTok skits and be more entertained than watching this. An half Irish guy as a mob boss, makes no sense at all, you have to be a full blooded Italian and a made man, this guy was literally a pleb nobody.

Sonny (Gerard Daly ) has an Italian mother (Maria Fiorentini ) and an Irish father who separated when he was a child. Raised in Rome he inherits the Godfather position from his uncle. When a son he didn't know he had in Ireland is killed (apparently conceived on a trip to visit his dad), Sonny vows revenge against the Irish gangsters.Apparently this is supposed to be a comedy or a spoof because it wasn't much of a crime story. It lacked the dialogue, swagger, and soundtrack of a comedy and relies strictly on plot which didn't carry the film.Guide: F-word. sex. brief nudity.

If you're not narrow minded and spoon fed on Hollywood blockbusters, like some of the ungrateful cry babies who posted reviews here, you might well enjoy this effort. It may look a bit cliche',-but it works and It's not pretentious, and it's even funny. I enjoyed this more than the last ten movies i watched; cinema releases included. If you liked 'Blood Car - you will like this as well.

One of, if not THE greatest mobster films of all time. Sonny Capone is a cinematic masterpiece from start to finish with it's brilliant pacing, brilliant performances and brilliant storytelling from the director Gerard Dalye. It's a film that is virtually flawless as there's not a single shot or edit that drags. There's nothing you could possibly change or clip from this final cut, you'd be hard pressed to nitpick anything wrong with this 90min classic. What makes Sonny Capone stand out from other gangster films is it's brutal portrayal of a life of crime, and nails every detail of the highs and lows in such a way that's cinematically stunning. So many iconic, quotable scenes make this one of the gangster films of all time.
